text:
so I'm going to show you how to make shrimp 
stock from your shrimp head you haven't get

shrimp with the heads and shells still on 
this is a perfect way to use them so I've

got a pot here with a little bit of oil 
on the bottom and all the heads now you

can use the shells as well but I'm actually 
leaving the shells on the shrimp for this

one I just want to saute it until the 
bits on the bottom start to get brown

so these are spot prawns so they're already 
pink when they're raw so normally your shrimp

might be gray and those turn pink during the 
cooking and the reason why we're using the

heads is because the head is what contains 
the fat and therefore the flavor sometimes

some people just like to suck all that good 
stuff out of the head we're going to render

that into the liquid so now that you've got 
some brown bits in the bottom you're going to

go in and deglaze it with water and adding 
so I want four cups of shrimp sauce so I'm

adding a little more than four cups to allow 
for evaporation and then now I'm going to let

this come to a boil and let it simmer for 3045 
minutes we'll say 45 minutes so it's been about

45 minutes and I'm going to go ahead and strain 
the stock now you could add onions and carrots

celery and that turn it into a western style 
shrimp stock which you can then use for soup

or gumbo or whatever but since we're using this 
in Thai food in boom yam I'll infuse the herbs

into that later so I'm not adding any verbs to 
this one and so I'm just going to strain out

the heads and I'm saving I'm just gonna press 
out any final juices till that's sometimes a

juice the stock gets caught in the shrimp heads 
and I'm going to save the head for garnish from

my soup and you can save it for garnish for your 
soup as well and there we have it so basics tricks
